column4: When I'm doing 'fakeroot make-jpkg jdk-1_5_0_05-linux-i586.bin' (official file downloaded from java.sun.com) in order to create a .deb package for it it loads some plugins, but then tells me that none of those match what I'm trying to do.. Can someone tell me how I can install java SDK 1.5 then?
Should I just copy it somewhere and change the PATH variable ?
thanks kemik, I'll test the link.
pm? From the bot, or from you? Because I can only see one from the bot..
'fakeroot make-jpkg jdk-1_5_0_05-linux-i586.bin' <-- that was what I did
after setting it a+x of course.
you dont need to set it +x if you use make-jpkg
your java-package deb is too old. using hoary?
i tried that 2 days ago and it worked
yea, that's what I did as well (in the same dir as the .bin tho), but it tells me it needs a plugin.
are you sure you did it with the JDK of 1.5 ?
i can send you the deb i created
its just the output of make-jpkg on my system
what version of java-package do you have?
Okay.. Let me show you mine ;-)
i have version 0.26 of java-package installed
